name: nay
content:
nay adverb
(EVEN MORE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal used to introduce a second and more extreme phrase in a sentence when the first phrase was not strong enough: It is my pleasure, nay privilege, to introduce tonight's guest speaker.

nay adverb
(NO)
Northern English for
no : Nay lass, don't cry.

especially in the UK parliament, a vote to show that someone does not support a suggestion, idea, suggested law, etc., or a person who votes "no": The ayes and nays of the final vote are not recorded. The two nays were men who had once worked for Colonel Barton. Compare
no
aye
yea
